page.title: 11SWANDEAN HOSPITAL
page.content: The Present:early in 1985,Swandean Hospital was threatened with closure, because of the cutbacks affecting the National Health Service.A publicity campaign was mounted by the Friends of Swandean Hospital,and later in the year the threat of closure was lifted. The hospital is 3.2 ha.2 in area and plays a vital role for the long term elderly sick and the young chronic sick. Swandean Hospital has 110 staff,a swimming pool and a staff recreation building. The Future:Swandean Hospital is hoping to extend its buildings,at a cost of Â£150,000.It will be completed in the year 2000.They will extend the Young chronic sick and the Elderly departments so they can have more beds in each.
